00001 //  boost cstdint.hpp header file  ------------------------------------------//
00002 
00003 //  (C) Copyright boost.org 1999. Permission to copy, use, modify, sell
00004 //  and distribute this software is granted provided this copyright
00005 //  notice appears in all copies. This software is provided "as is" without
00006 //  express or implied warranty, and with no claim as to its suitability for

00009 //  See http://www.boost.org/libs/integer for documentation.
00010 
00011 //  Revision History
00012 //   31 Oct 01  use BOOST_HAS_LONG_LONG to check for "long long" (Jens M.)
00013 //   16 Apr 01  check LONGLONG_MAX when looking for "long long" (Jens Maurer)
00014 //   23 Jan 01  prefer "long" over "int" for int32_t and intmax_t (Jens Maurer)
00015 //   12 Nov 00  Merged <boost/stdint.h> (Jens Maurer)
00016 //   23 Sep 00  Added INTXX_C macro support (John Maddock).
00017 //   22 Sep 00  Better 64-bit support (John Maddock)
00018 //   29 Jun 00  Reimplement to avoid including stdint.h within namespace boost
00019 //    8 Aug 99  Initial version (Beman Dawes)
00020

00022 #ifndef BOOST_CSTDINT_HPP
00023 #define BOOST_CSTDINT_HPP
00024 
00025 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00026 
00027 
00028 #ifdef BOOST_HAS_STDINT_H
00029 
00030 // The following #include is an implementation artifact; not part of interface.
00031 # ifdef __hpux
00032 // HP-UX has a vaguely nice <stdint.h> in a non-standard location
00033 #   include <inttypes.h>
00034 #   ifdef __STDC_32_MODE__
00035       // this is triggered with GCC, because it defines __cplusplus < 199707L
00036 #     define BOOST_NO_INT64_T
00037 #   endif 
00038 # elif defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__IBMCPP__)
00039 #   include <inttypes.h>
00040 # else
00041 #   include <stdint.h>
00042 # endif
00043 
00044 namespace boost
00045 {
00046 
00047   using ::int8_t;             
00048   using ::int_least8_t;       
00049   using ::int_fast8_t;        
00050   using ::uint8_t;            
00051   using ::uint_least8_t;      
00052   using ::uint_fast8_t;       
00053                      
00054   using ::int16_t;            
00055   using ::int_least16_t;      
00056   using ::int_fast16_t;       
00057   using ::uint16_t;           
00058   using ::uint_least16_t;     
00059   using ::uint_fast16_t;      
00060                      
00061   using ::int32_t;            
00062   using ::int_least32_t;      
00063   using ::int_fast32_t;       
00064   using ::uint32_t;           
00065   using ::uint_least32_t;     
00066   using ::uint_fast32_t;      
00067                      
00068 # ifndef BOOST_NO_INT64_T
00069 
00070   using ::int64_t;            
00071   using ::int_least64_t;      
00072   using ::int_fast64_t;       
00073   using ::uint64_t;

00084 #elif defined(__FreeBSD__) && (__FreeBSD__ <= 4)
00085 // FreeBSD has an <inttypes.h> that contains much of what we need
00086 # include <inttypes.h>

00088 namespace boost {
00089 
00090   using ::int8_t;             
00091   typedef int8_t int_least8_t;       
00092   typedef int8_t int_fast8_t;        
00093   using ::uint8_t;            
00094   typedef uint8_t uint_least8_t;      
00095   typedef uint8_t uint_fast8_t;       
00096                      
00097   using ::int16_t;            
00098   typedef int16_t int_least16_t;      
00099   typedef int16_t int_fast16_t;       
00100   using ::uint16_t;           
00101   typedef uint16_t uint_least16_t;     
00102   typedef uint16_t uint_fast16_t;      
00103                      
00104   using ::int32_t;            
00105   typedef int32_t int_least32_t;      
00106   typedef int32_t int_fast32_t;       
00107   using ::uint32_t;           
00108   typedef uint32_t uint_least32_t;     
00109   typedef uint32_t uint_fast32_t;      
00110          
00111 # ifndef BOOST_NO_INT64_T          
00112 
00113   using ::int64_t;            
00114   typedef int64_t int_least64_t;      
00115   typedef int64_t int_fast64_t;       
00116   using ::uint64_t;           
00117   typedef uint64_t uint_least64_t;     
00118   typedef uint64_t uint_fast64_t;      
00119 
00120   typedef int64_t intmax_t;
00121   typedef uint64_t uintmax_t;
00122 
00123 # else
00124 
00125   typedef int32_t intmax_t;
00126   typedef uint32_t uintmax_t;
00127 
00128 # endif

00136 
00137 namespace boost
00138 {
00139 
00140 //  These are fairly safe guesses for some 16-bit, and most 32-bit and 64-bit
00141 //  platforms.  For other systems, they will have to be hand tailored.
00142 //
00143 //  Because the fast types are assumed to be the same as the undecorated types,
00144 //  it may be possible to hand tailor a more efficient implementation.  Such
00145 //  an optimization may be illusionary; on the Intel x86-family 386 on, for
00146 //  example, byte arithmetic and load/stores are as fast as "int" sized ones.
00147 
00148 //  8-bit types  ------------------------------------------------------------//
00149 
00150 # if UCHAR_MAX == 0xff
00151      typedef signed char     int8_t;
00152      typedef signed char     int_least8_t;
00153      typedef signed char     int_fast8_t;
00154      typedef unsigned char   uint8_t;
00155      typedef unsigned char   uint_least8_t;
00156      typedef unsigned char   uint_fast8_t;
00157 # else
00158 #    error defaults not correct; you must hand modify boost/cstdint.hpp
00159 # endif
00160 
00161 //  16-bit types  -----------------------------------------------------------//
00162 
00163 # if USHRT_MAX == 0xffff
00164 #  if defined(__crayx1)
00165      // The Cray X1 has a 16-bit short, however it is not recommend
00166      // for use in performance critical code.
00167      typedef short           int16_t;
00168      typedef short           int_least16_t;
00169      typedef int             int_fast16_t;
00170      typedef unsigned short  uint16_t;
00171      typedef unsigned short  uint_least16_t;
00172      typedef unsigned int    uint_fast16_t;
00173 #  else
00174      typedef short           int16_t;
00175      typedef short           int_least16_t;
00176      typedef short           int_fast16_t;
00177      typedef unsigned short  uint16_t;
00178      typedef unsigned short  uint_least16_t;
00179      typedef unsigned short  uint_fast16_t;
00180 #  endif
00181 # elif (USHRT_MAX == 0xffffffff) && defined(CRAY)
00182      // no 16-bit types on Cray:
00183      typedef short           int_least16_t;
00184      typedef short           int_fast16_t;
00185      typedef unsigned short  uint_least16_t;
00186      typedef unsigned short  uint_fast16_t;
00187 # else
00188 #    error defaults not correct; you must hand modify boost/cstdint.hpp
00189 # endif
00190 
00191 //  32-bit types  -----------------------------------------------------------//
00192 
00193 # if ULONG_MAX == 0xffffffff
00194      typedef long            int32_t;
00195      typedef long            int_least32_t;
00196      typedef long            int_fast32_t;
00197      typedef unsigned long   uint32_t;
00198      typedef unsigned long   uint_least32_t;
00199      typedef unsigned long   uint_fast32_t;
00200 # elif UINT_MAX == 0xffffffff
00201      typedef int             int32_t;
00202      typedef int             int_least32_t;
00203      typedef int             int_fast32_t;
00204      typedef unsigned int    uint32_t;
00205      typedef unsigned int    uint_least32_t;
00206      typedef unsigned int    uint_fast32_t;
00207 # else
00208 #    error defaults not correct; you must hand modify boost/cstdint.hpp
00209 # endif
00210 
00211 //  64-bit types + intmax_t and uintmax_t  ----------------------------------//
00212 
00213 # if defined(BOOST_HAS_LONG_LONG) && \
00214    !defined(BOOST_MSVC) && !defined(__BORLANDC__) && \
00215    (!defined(__GLIBCPP__) || defined(_GLIBCPP_USE_LONG_LONG)) && \
00216    (defined(ULLONG_MAX) || defined(ULONG_LONG_MAX) || defined(ULONGLONG_MAX))
00217 #    if defined(__hpux)
00218      // HP-UX's value of ULONG_LONG_MAX is unusable in preprocessor expressions
00219 #    elif (defined(ULLONG_MAX) && ULLONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615ULL) || (defined(ULONG_LONG_MAX) && ULONG_LONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615ULL) || (defined(ULONGLONG_MAX) && ULONGLONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615ULL)
00220                                                                  // 2**64 - 1
00221 #    else
00222 #       error defaults not correct; you must hand modify boost/cstdint.hpp
00223 #    endif
00224 
00225      typedef long long            intmax_t;
00226      typedef unsigned long long   uintmax_t;
00227      typedef long long            int64_t;
00228      typedef long long            int_least64_t;
00229      typedef long long            int_fast64_t;
00230      typedef unsigned long long   uint64_t;
00231      typedef unsigned long long   uint_least64_t;
00232      typedef unsigned long long   uint_fast64_t;
00233 
00234 # elif ULONG_MAX != 0xffffffff
00235 
00236 #    if ULONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615 // 2**64 - 1
00237      typedef long                 intmax_t;
00238      typedef unsigned long        uintmax_t;
00239      typedef long                 int64_t;
00240      typedef long                 int_least64_t;
00241      typedef long                 int_fast64_t;
00242      typedef unsigned long        uint64_t;
00243      typedef unsigned long        uint_least64_t;
00244      typedef unsigned long        uint_fast64_t;
00245 #    else
00246 #       error defaults not correct; you must hand modify boost/cstdint.hpp
00247 #    endif
00248 # elif defined(__GNUC__) && defined(BOOST_HAS_LONG_LONG)
00249      __extension__ typedef long long            intmax_t;
00250      __extension__ typedef unsigned long long   uintmax_t;
00251      __extension__ typedef long long            int64_t;
00252      __extension__ typedef long long            int_least64_t;
00253      __extension__ typedef long long            int_fast64_t;
00254      __extension__ typedef unsigned long long   uint64_t;
00255      __extension__ typedef unsigned long long   uint_least64_t;
00256      __extension__ typedef unsigned long long   uint_fast64_t;
00257 # elif defined(BOOST_HAS_MS_INT64)
00258      //
00259      // we have Borland/Intel/Microsoft __int64:
00260      //
00261      typedef __int64             intmax_t;
00262      typedef unsigned __int64    uintmax_t;
00263      typedef __int64             int64_t;
00264      typedef __int64             int_least64_t;
00265      typedef __int64             int_fast64_t;
00266      typedef unsigned __int64    uint64_t;
00267      typedef unsigned __int64    uint_least64_t;
00268      typedef unsigned __int64    uint_fast64_t;
00269 # else // assume no 64-bit integers
00270 #  define BOOST_NO_INT64_T
00271      typedef int32_t              intmax_t;
00272      typedef uint32_t             uintmax_t;
00273 # endif
00274 
00275 } // namespace boost
00276 
00277 
00278 #endif // BOOST_HAS_STDINT_H
00279 
00280 #endif // BOOST_CSTDINT_HPP
00281 
00282 
00283 /****************************************************
00284 
00285 Macro definition section:
00286 
00287 Define various INTXX_C macros only if
00288 __STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS is defined.
00289 
00290 Undefine the macros if __STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS is
00291 not defined and the macros are (cf <cassert>).
00292 
00293 Added 23rd September 2000 (John Maddock).
00294 Modified 11th September 2001 to be excluded when
00295 BOOST_HAS_STDINT_H is defined (John Maddock).
00296 
00297 ******************************************************/
00298 
00299 #if defined(__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS) && !defined(BOOST__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS_DEFINED) && !defined(BOOST_HAS_STDINT_H)
00300 # define BOOST__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS_DEFINED
00301 # if defined(BOOST_HAS_MS_INT64)
00302 //
00303 // Borland/Intel/Microsoft compilers have width specific suffixes:
00304 //
00305 #  define INT8_C(value)     value##i8
00306 #  define INT16_C(value)    value##i16
00307 #  define INT32_C(value)    value##i32
00308 #  define INT64_C(value)    value##i64
00309 #  ifdef __BORLANDC__
00310     // Borland bug: appending ui8 makes the type a signed char
00311 #   define UINT8_C(value)    static_cast<unsigned char>(value##u)
00312 #  else
00313 #   define UINT8_C(value)    value##ui8
00314 #  endif
00315 #  define UINT16_C(value)   value##ui16
00316 #  define UINT32_C(value)   value##ui32
00317 #  define UINT64_C(value)   value##ui64
00318 #  define INTMAX_C(value)   value##i64
00319 #  define UINTMAX_C(value)  value##ui64
00320 
00321 # else
00322 //  do it the old fashioned way:
00323 
00324 //  8-bit types  ------------------------------------------------------------//
00325 
00326 #  if UCHAR_MAX == 0xff
00327 #   define INT8_C(value) static_cast<boost::int8_t>(value)
00328 #   define UINT8_C(value) static_cast<boost::uint8_t>(value##u)
00329 #  endif
00330 
00331 //  16-bit types  -----------------------------------------------------------//
00332 
00333 #  if USHRT_MAX == 0xffff
00334 #   define INT16_C(value) static_cast<boost::int16_t>(value)
00335 #   define UINT16_C(value) static_cast<boost::uint16_t>(value##u)
00336 #  endif
00337 
00338 //  32-bit types  -----------------------------------------------------------//
00339 
00340 #  if UINT_MAX == 0xffffffff
00341 #   define INT32_C(value) value
00342 #   define UINT32_C(value) value##u
00343 #  elif ULONG_MAX == 0xffffffff
00344 #   define INT32_C(value) value##L
00345 #   define UINT32_C(value) value##uL
00346 #  endif
00347 
00348 //  64-bit types + intmax_t and uintmax_t  ----------------------------------//
00349 
00350 #  if defined(BOOST_HAS_LONG_LONG) && \
00351     (defined(ULLONG_MAX) || defined(ULONG_LONG_MAX) || defined(ULONGLONG_MAX))
00352 
00353 #    if defined(__hpux)
00354      // HP-UX's value of ULONG_LONG_MAX is unusable in preprocessor expressions
00355 #    elif (defined(ULLONG_MAX) && ULLONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615U) ||  \
00356         (defined(ULONG_LONG_MAX) && ULONG_LONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615U) ||  \
00357         (defined(ULONGLONG_MAX) && ULONGLONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615U)
00358 
00359 #    else
00360 #       error defaults not correct; you must hand modify boost/cstdint.hpp
00361 #    endif
00362 #    define INT64_C(value) value##LL
00363 #    define UINT64_C(value) value##uLL
00364 #  elif ULONG_MAX != 0xffffffff
00365 
00366 #    if ULONG_MAX == 18446744073709551615 // 2**64 - 1
00367 #       define INT64_C(value) value##L
00368 #       define UINT64_C(value) value##uL
00369 #    else
00370 #       error defaults not correct; you must hand modify boost/cstdint.hpp
00371 #    endif
00372 #  endif
00373 
00374 #  ifdef BOOST_NO_INT64_T
00375 #   define INTMAX_C(value) INT32_C(value)
00376 #   define UINTMAX_C(value) UINT32_C(value)
00377 #  else
00378 #   define INTMAX_C(value) INT64_C(value)
00379 #   define UINTMAX_C(value) UINT64_C(value)
00380 #  endif
00381 
00382 # endif // Borland/Microsoft specific width suffixes
00383 
00384 
00385 #elif defined(BOOST__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS_DEFINED) && !defined(__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS) && !defined(BOOST_HAS_STDINT_H)
00386 //
00387 // undef all the macros:
00388 //
00389 # undef INT8_C
00390 # undef INT16_C
00391 # undef INT32_C
00392 # undef INT64_C
00393 # undef UINT8_C
00394 # undef UINT16_C
00395 # undef UINT32_C
00396 # undef UINT64_C
00397 # undef INTMAX_C
00398 # undef UINTMAX_C
00399 
00400 #endif // __STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS_DEFINED etc.
